function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Examination of multi-disciplinary literature on how planning and designing cities intersects with pandemics of infectious respiratory diseases.","Impact":"Limited scope may overlook unique challenges of different pandemics, leading to ineffective planning and design strategies.","Mitigation":"Include specific search terms for different infectious respiratory diseases to capture a comprehensive understanding of challenges and best practices.","Technologies":"Text analysis tools for identifying and extracting relevant information from multi-disciplinary literature.","People":"Researchers, urban planners, and designers.","Owner":"Research team and academic institutions."},{"Description":"Limiting search terms based on authors' personal interests may lead to overlooking important aspects of the intersection between pandemics and urban planning.","Impact":"Reduction in the diversity of literature and potential exclusion of relevant studies and perspectives.","Mitigation":"Engage multiple authors with diverse expertise to broaden the scope and ensure comprehensive search terms.","Technologies":"Collaborative research platforms for brainstorming and refining search terms.","People":"Authors of the study.","Owner":"Research team and academic institutions."},{"Description":"Rapid review process may result in overlooking key studies and relevant literature, leading to biased conclusions and recommendations.","Impact":"Incomplete understanding of the intersection between pandemics and urban planning, leading to ineffective strategies and interventions.","Mitigation":"Conduct a thorough and systematic review of literature, including comprehensive search across diverse databases and peer-reviewed journals.","Technologies":"Systematic review software for managing and analyzing large volumes of literature data.","People":"Researchers and professionals in public health and urban planning.","Owner":"Research team and academic institutions."}]}
